Yet, with so many options, choosing where to stay can often feel like searching for a needle in a haystack. And that’s where Yatzer comes in. This year, we’ve scoured the Cyclades, Crete, and beyond to handpick six exceptional retreats that stand out for their visionary design, intimate atmosphere, and ability to immerse guests in the magic of their surroundings. Dreamy Greek Retreats for Your Summer Getaway

Few destinations capture the essence of summer quite like Greece. From its sun-drenched beaches and crystalline waters to its timeless architecture and cultural gems, the country’s allure is quite simply irresistible. Whether you’re dreaming of dancing under the stars in cosmopolitan Mykonos, unwinding in tranquil havens like Antiparos or Sifnos, or discovering hidden gems in Crete and Rhodes, Greece offers a dazzling array of experiences to suit every traveler’s whim.

Every summer, new hotels spring to life, each vying to outdo the last in style, comfort, and creativity, making Greece’s hospitality scene as dynamic as its landscapes. Yet, with so many options, choosing where to stay can often feel like searching for a needle in a haystack. And that’s where Yatzer comes in. This year, we’ve scoured the Cyclades, Crete, and beyond to handpick six exceptional retreats that stand out for their visionary design, intimate atmosphere, and ability to immerse guests in the magic of their surroundings. From cliffside sanctuaries and bohemian-chic escapes to heritage-infused havens, these hotels represent the very best of what Greece has to offer.

So, why wait? Now is the perfect time to answer the call of the ethereal Aegean. Choose from our carefully curated selection of awe-inspiring properties for your next Greek adventure to enter the world of beauty, blissful relaxation, and mindfulness that you’ve been searching for.

Crete_ Acro Suites
Clinging high on a clifftop on Crete’s dramatic northern coastline, this adults-only wellness retreat redefines luxury with an ethos of serene seclusion and holistic harmony. A short 20-minute drive from Heraklion, Acro Suites stands out for its cinematic setting, focus on wellbeing and ascetic design inspired by the island’s rugged beauty.

Its 49 suites and villas, each boasting a private pool, offer unparalleled privacy while echoing Crete’s essence through earthy tones, organic materials, and handcrafted details where reclaimed wood furniture, textured plaster walls mimicking local stone, and sleek marble accents create interiors that feel both timeless and grounded.

Acro Suites’ heart of course lies a dedication to holistic wellness. The Bath House, inspired by Byzantine hammams, offers a tranquil sanctuary where guests can indulge in rejuvenating treatments that blend ancient techniques with modern practices, or unwind in the hammam, dry sauna, and jacuzzi. Complementing this experience are a serene yoga studio, an outdoor pool and a fully equipped fitness center, all three overlooking the breathtaking Aegean Sea, where bespoke programs are designed to help guests restore balance and harmony.

Cremnos, the resort’s fine dining restaurant, reinvents Cretan classics using organic, locally sourced ingredients. For a more immersive experience, Eleonas offers al fresco dining in an olive grove, connecting guests with the island’s culinary heritage.

BOOK YOUR STAY_______
Acro Suites, Agia Pelagia, Heraklion, Crete.

Antiparos_ The Rooster
Tucked away on the serene island of Antiparos, The Rooster is a secluded retreat that embodies the soulful simplicity of the Cycladic way of life. Much like the island itself, it is intimate, low-key, and deeply connected to its surroundings, offering a chance to shed life’s distractions and focus on what truly matters.

Scattered across gentle hills, untamed gardens, and golden sand dunes, The Rooster’s 16 houses have all been thoughtfully positioned to maximize privacy, views, and harmony with the elements. Inspired by the island’s traditional katikies (farmer’s cottages), these low-rise residences designed by local practice VOIS Architects are built from tawny local stone and sand-colored plaster, with dry-stone walls blending seamlessly into the landscape.

Generous living spaces flow effortlessly between indoors and outdoors, featuring private pools, invigorating outdoor showers, and apertures framing swaying grasses, the shimmering Aegean, and ever-changing sunsets. Inside, the houses evoke a nomadic elegance, with Balinese daybeds, velvet ikat cushions, driftwood four-posters, and hand-blown glassware creating a relaxed, uncontrived aesthetic.

Culinary offerings at The Rooster are equally exceptional. Chef Simos Triantafyllou transforms the island’s freshest ingredients—the daily catch straight from the sea, free-range meats, and produce from the on-site organic farm—into farm-to-fork feasts, wood-fired lunches, and communal Sunday suppers exclusively for guests.

Wellness meanwhile takes center stage at The House of Healing, where intuitive practitioners offer holistic therapies inspired by traditions from across the globe.

BOOK YOUR STAY_______
The Rooster, Livadia bay, Antiparos.

Mykonos_ Anandes Hotel
Situated at the highest point of Mykonos Town, Anandes Hotel offers a luxurious escape that celebrates the island’s Cycladic heritage while embracing contemporary elegance. Overlooking the Town’s whitewashed houses, iconic windmills, and the Aegean beyond, the hotel enjoys a prime location—close enough to the vibrant energy of the island’s capital yet perfectly secluded for those seeking serene relaxation.

The 42 luxurious rooms and suites, many featuring private pools or Jacuzzis, are designed to maximize the breathtaking views and provide an unparalleled sense of exclusivity. Interiors by Studio Bonarchi reimagine Cycladic tradition through a modern lens, pairing whitewashed surfaces and organic forms with rich timberwork in darker shades, textured stone, and bronze accents. Lead interior designer Vangelis Bonios has enriched a muted palette with linen fabrics and splashes of navy blue, reflecting the island’s naval heritage, while bespoke furniture that reimagine traditional Greek icons, mid-century-modern pieces, and contemporary artworks by the likes of Richard Serra and Thomas Houseago add layers of sophistication.

At the heart of the hotel’s offerings is La Petite Maison Restaurant & Bar, a culinary haven inspired by the French Riviera. Located poolside with sweeping sea views, it serves a refined menu blending the best of French and Mediterranean cuisine.

The spa at Anandes Hotel takes wellness to new heights, with treatments ranging from hypnotherapy and reiki to its signature cinta therapy, complemented by a hammam, sauna, and a 24-hour state-of-the-art gym.

BOOK YOUR STAY_______
Anandes Hotel, Mykonos.

Tinos_ Odera Tinos
Set above the tranquil shores of Vourni Beach on the Cycladic island of Tinos, Odera Hotel invites travellers to escape the rush of daily life and embrace a slower, more meaningful pace. As part of the Autograph Collection, this five-star retreat offers a harmonious blend of luxury, spirituality, and timeless Cycladic charm.

The resort’s 77 pool suites and rooms are meticulously designed, each offering stunning views of the Aegean Sea. Interiors by Studio Bonarchi's lead interior designer Vangelis Bonios reflect the island’s reputation as a spiritual haven—there are more than 700 Catholic and Orthodox churches in Tinos—channelling soulful simplicity through an ascetic aesthetic. Handcrafted details pay homage to Tinos’ renowned artisans and marble sculptors, with design elements including engraved stone headboards inspired by the island’s iconic pigeon houses and black-and-white pebble floor patterns celebrating Aegean artisanal traditions. Even upon entering, the island’s piety is referenced in the lobby’s sequence of arches: evoking the mysticism of the Ursuline convent, they create a serene introduction to the Odera experience.

Guests can unwind at the resort’s pool or organized sandy beach, complete with a chic beach bar. Dining is a highlight, with Executive Chef Dimitris Skarmoutsos crafting Mediterranean dishes rooted in Cycladic tradition and local produce both at the All-Day Pool Bar & Restaurant and Eos Bar & Restaurant.

For holistic well-being, the O Wellness Centre offers a state-of-the-art gym, indoor pool, hammam, Zerobody dry floatation, and an array of treatments using local minerals and premium products, ensuring for total rejuvenation whilst vacationing in this island sanctuary.

BOOK YOUR STAY_______
Odera Tinos, Autograph Collection, Vourni beach, Tinos, Greece.

Sifnos_ NÓS Hotel & Villas
Perched above the Aegean Sea on Sifnos’ rugged coastline, NÓS Hotel & Villas is a tranquil hideaway of understated sophistication inspired by the island’s timeless authenticity and unique allure—Sifnos stands out among the Cycladic islands for its countless chapels scattered across rocky promontories, its pottery tradition, and its celebrated culinary heritage.

Designed by K-Studio with intimacy, serenity and elegance in mind, the hotel’s 18 rooms and suites reflect the island’s vernacular grace and handcrafted finesse. Spread across four stone buildings, the accommodations showcase bright and spacious interiors that flow seamlessly into private courtyards, terraces, and balconies, fostering a harmonious indoor-outdoor living experience. A soothing palette of beige, sand, and cream tones is complemented by natural textures of stone and wood, soft fabrics, and artisanal ceramics, creating a pared-back aesthetic of refined simplicity. The effect is a calming, laid-back environment that feels effortlessly like home.

Under the guidance of Executive Chef Athenagoras Kostakos, NÓS The Restaurant conjures up innovative dishes rooted in the island’s rich culinary tradition accompanied by sweeping views of the Aegean Sea and the island’s iconic Chrysopigi church from the hotel’s poolside terrace.

Wellness is elevated with bespoke treatments by award-winning SPA brand Ariadne Athens, while the open-air gym perfectly pairs fitness with spectacular sea views. Completing the luxury experience, private RIBS are available for guests, to discover Sifnos’ hidden treasures.

BOOK YOUR STAY_______
NÓS Hotel & Villas, Faros, Sifnos, Greece.

Rhodes_ Casita Casita Lindos
Nestled within an olive grove near Lindos, a historic fishing village in Rhodes renowned for its fourth-century BC acropolis, Casita Casita Lindos is a boutique, seven-room retreat that exudes tranquility and understated luxury.

Once an abandoned nightclub, the property has been masterfully reimagined by architect Vana Pernari into a serene escape whose eclectic charm echoes the village’s rich history and bohemian allure. Each of the seven suites is a curated sanctuary, blending globally sourced treasures like tribal carpets, Suzani throws, and vintage ceramics with thoughtful comforts such as organic mattresses, crisp linens, and amenities crafted from local honey and herbs. Outside, the 2,000-square-metre property enchants with its rugged rocky landscape, Mediterranean gardens, and an olive grove where local wild goats pay the occasional visit.

Guests can unwind by the pool, soaking in the soothing hum of cicadas and the nearby sea breeze, or enjoy the golden sands and turquoise waters of Lindos Beach, a leisurely six-minute walk away.

Dining at Casita Casita is a sensory delight, with meals prepared using olive oil from the family’s groves and enjoyed al fresco beneath the canopy of timeless trees, all while gazing at the majestic acropolis above. Here, every detail invites guests to slow down, connect with nature, and rediscover life’s simple pleasures.

BOOK YOUR STAY_______
Casita Casita Lindos, Rhodes, Greece.
